details:
Jim Jagielski reports:

> CVE-2015-3183 (cve.mitre.org)
> core: Fix chunk header parsing defect.
> Remove apr\_brigade\_flatten(), buffering and duplicated code from
> the HTTP\_IN filter, parse chunks in a single pass with zero copy.
> Limit accepted chunk-size to 2^63-1 and be strict about chunk-ext
> authorized characters.
>
> CVE-2015-3185 (cve.mitre.org)
> Replacement of ap\_some\_auth\_required (unusable in Apache httpd 2.4)
> with new ap\_some\_authn\_required and ap\_force\_authn hook.
>
> CVE-2015-0253 (cve.mitre.org)
> core: Fix a crash with ErrorDocument 400 pointing to a local URL-path
> with the INCLUDES filter active, introduced in 2.4.11. PR 57531.
>
> CVE-2015-0228 (cve.mitre.org)
> mod\_lua: A maliciously crafted websockets PING after a script
> calls r:wsupgrade() can cause a child process crash.
